item.description: Ryuki Shimada Bio I’m a Ph.D. student at Ishigami Lab., Keio University, Japan. I’m also a research assistant at Artificial Intelligence Research Center (AIRC), National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST), Japan. Research Interests Tethered mobile robot system Path planning Mechanics Academic Background Doctoral Program (Sep. 2023 - current) Graduate School of Integrated Design Engineering, Keio Univerisity (Advisor: Dr. Genya Ishigami) M.S. in Engineering (Sep. 2021 - Sep. 2023)

Publications Journal Papers Ryuki Shimada and Genya Ishigami. “Tangle- and Contact-free Path Planning for a Tethered Mobile Robot using Deep Reinforcement Learning.” Frontiers in Robotics and AI, 11:1388634, 2024. [Paper] International Conferences Ryuki Shimada and Genya Ishigami. “Path Planning with Cable-obstacles Avoidance for a Tethered Mobile Robot in Unstructured Environments.” The 34th International Symposium on Space Technology and Science (ISTS), 2023-k-04, Kurume City Plaza, June 2023. [Paper]
